snippet: Pope Francis, in naming bishops to a powerful Vatican committee, replaced a conservative American cardinal with another American considered more of a moderate on social issues.
abstract: Pope Francis replaces conservative American Cardinal Raymond L Burke on the powerful Congregation for Bishops with Cardinal Donal Wuerl, who is less identified with the culture wars within the Roman Catholic Church; action regarding Burke, who has been an outspoken critic of abortion and same-sex marriage, is viewed by experts as another sign of Pope's commitment to inclusive agenda.

byline.original: By JIM YARDLEY and JASON HOROWITZ
byline.contributor: Jim Yardley reported from Rome, and Jason Horowitz from Washington. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.

lead_paragraph: Pope Francis, in naming bishops to a powerful Vatican committee, replaced a conservative American cardinal with another American considered more of a moderate on social issues.

headline.main: Pope Replaces Conservative U.S. Cardinal on Influential Vatican Committee
headline.print_headline: Pope Replaces Conservative U.S. Cardinal on Influential Vatican Committee

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
